entry.tran: 吨(在英国等于2,240 磅;在美国等于 2,000 磅)
entry.def: A ton is a unit of weight that is equal to 2240 pounds in Britain and to 2000 pounds in the United States.

example.ex: Hundreds of tons of oil spilled into the sea...
example.tran: 数百吨石油溢出流入大海。

example.ex: Getting rid of rubbish can cost $100 a ton.
example.tran: 清除垃圾每吨要花费 100 美元。

entry.def: A ton is the same as a tonne .
If someone comes down on you like a ton of bricks, they are extremely angry with you and tell you off because of something wrong that you have done.

example.ex: If you do something awful they all come down on you like a ton of bricks.
example.tran: 如果你做了错事，他们全都会对你大发雷霆。

entry.def: If you say that something weighs a ton, you mean that it is extremely heavy.

Sentence.sentence: Amazon plants, for instance, hold more than 100 billion metric tons of carbon, equal to 15 years of tailpipe and chimney emissions.
billion metric tons of carbon into the atmosphere each year - making forests the leading source of greenhouse gases

Each burning season in the Amazon, fires deliberately set by frontier settlers and developers hurl up almost half a billion metric tons of carbon a year, placing Brazil among the top five contributors to greenhouse gases in the world.
